TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class BluetoothHeadset : Java.Lang.Object, Android.Bluetooth.IBluetoothProfile, IDisposable

.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit BluetoothHeadset extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Bluetooth.IBluetoothProfile, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Public API for controlling the Bluetooth Headset Service.

remarks.para: Public API for controlling the Bluetooth Headset Service. This includes both Bluetooth Headset and Handsfree (v1.5) profiles.
BluetoothHeadset is a proxy object for controlling the Bluetooth Headset Service via IPC.
Use to get the BluetoothHeadset proxy object. Use to close the service connection.
Android only supports one connected Bluetooth Headset at a time. Each method is protected with its appropriate permission.

Docs.summary: Intent used to broadcast the change in the Audio Connection state of the A2DP profile.

remarks.para: Intent used to broadcast the change in the Audio Connection state of the A2DP profile.

This intent will have 3 extras:
- The current state of the profile.
- The previous state of the profile.
- The remote device.
or can be any of , ,
Requires permission to receive.

Docs.summary: Intent used to broadcast the change in connection state of the Headset profile.

remarks.para: Intent used to broadcast the change in connection state of the Headset profile.

This intent will have 3 extras:
- The current state of the profile.
- The previous state of the profile.
- The remote device.
or can be any of , , , .
Requires permission to receive.

Docs.summary: Intent used to broadcast that the headset has posted a vendor-specific event.

remarks.para: Intent used to broadcast that the headset has posted a vendor-specific event.

This intent will have 4 extras and 1 category.
- The remote Bluetooth Device
- The vendor specific command
- The AT command type which can be one of , , or , ,.
- Command arguments.

The category is the Company ID of the vendor defining the vendor-specific command.
For example, for Plantronics specific events Category will be .55

For example, an AT+XEVENT=foo,3 will get translated into
EXTRA_VENDOR_SPECIFIC_HEADSET_EVENT_CMD = +XEVENT
EXTRA_VENDOR_SPECIFIC_HEADSET_EVENT_CMD_TYPE = AT_CMD_TYPE_SET
EXTRA_VENDOR_SPECIFIC_HEADSET_EVENT_ARGS = foo, 3
Requires permission to receive.

Docs.param: Array of states. States can be one of , , , ,
Docs.summary: Get a list of devices that match any of the given connection states.

remarks.para: Get a list of devices that match any of the given connection states.
If none of the devices match any of the given states, an empty list will be returned.
Requires permission.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SendVendorSpecificResultCode (Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device, string command, string arg);
.method public hidebysig instance bool SendVendorSpecificResultCode(class Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device, string command, string arg) cil managed

Docs.param: The argument that will be attached to the command.
Docs.summary: Sends a vendor-specific unsolicited result code to the headset.

remarks.para: Sends a vendor-specific unsolicited result code to the headset.
The actual string to be sent is command + ": " + arg. For example, if command is and arg is "0", the string "+ANDROID: 0" will be sent.
Currently only is allowed as command.
Requires permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool StartVoiceRecognition(class Android.Bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device) cil managed

Docs.summary: Start Bluetooth voice recognition.

remarks.para: Start Bluetooth voice recognition. This methods sends the voice recognition AT command to the headset and establishes the audio connection.
Users can listen to . If this function returns true, this intent will be broadcasted with set to .
will transition from to when audio connection is established and to in case of failure to establish the audio connection.
Requires permission.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
